alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 12 at 4:55PM CDT until May 12 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR RED WILLOW AND HITCHCOCK COUNTIES... At 454 PM CDT, a dust channel was 5 miles west of Culbertson, or 6 miles northeast of Trenton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Highway 34 and secondary roadways will be impacted. Locations impacted include... McCook, Trenton, Culbertson, Indianola, Palisade, Bartley and Danbury. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
